title: Use Log Rules
speech: We know that  n times the log base a of b is equal to the log base a of, parentheses b to the n-th  .\n, 2 times the log base 5 of x is equal to the log base 5 of, parentheses x squared

title: Matching bases
text: $$\log_{5}\left(x^2\right)$$ and $$\log_{5}\left(81\right)$$ have the same log base. $$\log_{5}\left(x^2\right)$$ and $$\log_{5}\left(81\right)$$, so we can see it as $$x^2=81$$
speech: the log base 5 of, parentheses x squared   and  the log base 5 of 81,  have the same log base. , the log base 5 of, parentheses x squared   and  the log base 5 of 81, , so we can see it as  x squared is equal to 81
pacedSpeech: the log base 5 of,  x squared
have the same log base.  , the log base 5 of,  x squared
, so we can see it as   x squared is equal to 81

title: Value of $$b$$ in $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$
text: $$x^2=81$$ has two solution $$x=9$$ and $$x=-9$$. Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, $$b$$ can not be negative. Therefore we can omit the negative answer. $$x=9$$ is the only solution for the given equation.
